reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was lovely. The room was delightful with old fashioned charm but superbly modernised. Luxury bathrooms, heated floor,spa baths and power showers. Having sensitive skin, it was nice to know I was using organic products and filtered water. The bed was devine. I was surprised at the variety of choice of the organic breakfast. The staff were friendly and very helpful at booking myself and my wife into local restaurants for dinner.Superb location. Grasmere is a pretty village.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have seen some differing reviews about this hotel, but I can say that I stayed here last year with my husband for a birthday getaway and loved everything about it. The spa bath with filtered water was luxury to me after a cold rainy day out and about. The breakfast was great. Unlike my husband I'm not one of those people who need to have a huge cooked breakfast every morning. I loved the Meditteranean food, and pastries. Our room was cosy, but big. Had an enormous bed, that was comfy. The only thing I can say is that some people were having a party in the hotel across the road one night that drove us mad. But thats not particularly the fault Moss Grove.
reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!
Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: I loved it. It was just what I needed after a hard year of working in London, to come to the country where I could just relax in a beautifully renovated hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked for 1 night mid week after looking at their web site. We arrived to find we had a room at the front with a balcony, lovely huge timber bed and nice bathroom. After leaving our car we had a walk around grasmere and checked out the various restuarants etc. After arriving back I asked the satff for recomendations for somewhere to eat and she gave me a list of the nicest places and offered to ring to make a booking. As we were looking for a casual place to go she recommended the hotel across the road and tweedies bar which we went to and was great, good food, guest beers and helpfull staff. After returning to the hotel we sat on our balcony on the chairs provided with a glass of wine. Overall this is a lovely hotel with very nice rooms but is a bit overpriced. There is no bar or cooked breakfast and no staff after 9, and get there early as the car park is a little small.
reviews.title: Lights out at 9

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is a misnomer for this establishment - make no mistake it's just a B & B. OK, it's a posh, modern B & B but with some serious flaws. Most people who go to the Lakes are walkers, climbers or cyclists...that's why Grasmere and all the other towns are heaving with outdoor clothes shops, cafes and restaurants. What do we want before we leave in the morning for a hard day's activity? You got it...breakfast. What do they provide here? A so-called mediterranean-style COLD buffet. That's OK for the med when you're lying by the pool with a glass of cool white white fizz in your hand at 10am and it's 40 degrees but whoever thought that it would also work at this latitude? It seems the main purpose of this ridiculous innovation is to make life as easy as possible for the proprietors.
reviews.title: Very overpriced Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in March 2009 for my partner's 35th Birthday weekend.
reviews.title: Absolutely dreadful hotel, pathetic service and useless onsite staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We woke up to no hot water in the hotel and so could not enjoy the spa bath in our room. We both ended up with cold showers and by the time they had even organised someone to come and look at it, we had to leave. Apparently, the hot water went off the night before, the onsite staff knew about it and yet waited until 10am the next morning - when most people check out - to do anything about it.
reviews.title: The Chronicles of Narnia

likes.disliked: — That I was unable to extend my stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was awful - a meditteranean style that would definitely not suit most palets and which was dry and poorly prepared. They don't serve it in a breakfast room but just dump it in the hotel kitchen and expect you to walk in and help yourselves. So you have to navigate your way through a small hallway to get to the kitchen, which is only big enough for 3-4 people, and get your own food. Rediculous. And all that whilst the onsite staff mills around and cleans dishes and stuff. Unreal.
reviews.title: Great for a weekend break in the winter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And this is an AA rated, FIVE STAR hotel supposedly. These things don't happen in hotels of this standard.
reviews.title: IDEAL BASE FOR A TRIP TO THE LAKES

reviews.text: The onsite staff are utterly, utterly useless and have no decision making authority whatsoever. The owner, Mrs Susan Lowe, is never to be seen around the place and so these guys can't make a decision without speaking to her.
reviews.title: Loved it
Great location, but not a true hotel
reviews.text: I have pondered long and hard over whether to give this 3 or 4 stars, and still not sure I've got it right. I see the average at this point in time is coming out at 3.5, and that's just about it, I think.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why more than 3 stars? Because it's in a fabulous location, smack in the middle of a charming village in fabulous countryside. Because it has been renovated with style and the rooms are nicely furnished and decorated, with huge bathrooms. There are jacuzzis in each, if that's your thing. It is also outstandingly clean and appetizing.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why less than four stars? This does not have the feel of a true hotel. There's never more than one member of staff around (or wasn't during our 3-day stay), which gives it more the feeling of an inn or up-market b&b than a true hotel. You're expected to clear your own breakfast things away (no hardship, but not what you'd call 5-star service), and the biggest letdown is that there is no outdoor space at all. On a pleasant day, you're forced to hunt down a pub or outdoor restaurant if you want to sit outside after a long hike (or, indeed, instead of one).
reviews.title: Organic Hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sole table in the lounge seats 8, and with 22 guests, that leaves 14 playing musical chairs with the remaining sofas and coffee tables. I prefer to eat at a table.
reviews.title: Great weekend break

likes.liked: — One of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in.
likes.disliked: — No guarantee that you'll get a seat at the table for breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our top-floor, supposedly superior room, was quite stuffy in spite of it being a bitter July weekend. I suspect that in warm weather it would be uncomfortably hot.
reviews.title: Good for a short break in the lakes

likes.liked: — Drinking organic champagne in the spa bath

reviews.title: Moss Grove - A wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: Moss Grove Organic Hotel is the best hotel we have ever stayed in.

reviews.title: Snobbery doesn't come cheap
reviews.text: Everything about the hotel, surroundings and experience is fantastic.

The hotel is impressive from the moment you walk in the front door. Things get even better as you walk into your room, We stayed in the Superior Room which had an enormous comfy bed and a wonderful bathroom with Jacuzzi Bath.
reviews.title: incredibly rude again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well fitted they even had a Bose Entertainment System which typified the high quality finish in the Hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely place, at last the lakes have a nice hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast (again all organic) was served from the kitchen. It was self service and you could either take your tray into the lounge area or back to the room - we ate in the lounge first morning.
reviews.title: Visit [--]
